  2966. REF: who is going to take the role of Mary Poppins , played 50 years ago by Julie Andrews , is not yet certain .

    HYP: anyone who plays Poppins more than 50 years after Julie Andrews is still unclear .


  2967. REF: but the director has been decided : Rob Marshall , whose most recent film was `` Into the Woods '' .

    HYP: but the director is already fixed : Rob Marshall , most recently with `` Into the Woods '' at the cinema .


  2968. REF: Xi urges to open economy wider to world

    HYP: Xi urged to open the economy wider for the world


  2969. REF: the economy must open wider to the outside world to fuel growth , President Xi Jinping told a group tasked with steering reform on Tuesday .

    HYP: the economy needs to open more broadly to the outside world to promote growth , President Xi Jinping said Tuesday of a group tasked with steering reform .


  2970. REF: `` China should be committed to attracting foreign investment and expertise , and improve opening-up policies , '' he said , addressing the 16th Meeting of the Central Leading Group for Deepening Overall Reform .

    HYP: `` China should be committed to attracting foreign investment and know-how and improving the strategies for business start-ups , '' he said in an address at the 16th session of the Central leadership group for deepening a comprehensive reform .


  2971. REF: promoting opening up while pushing forward reforms will add new impetus and vitality , and provide new room for economic growth , Xi said .

    HYP: encouraging new start-ups and advancing reforms will bring about new momentum and vitality and provide new space for economic growth , Xi said .


  2972. REF: the leading group adopted a series of guidelines including a negative list regulating market access , relaxation of border-control policies , encouraging state-owned enterprises ( SOE ) to absorb private capital and overhauling the resident registration system .

    HYP: the leadership group has adopted a series of guidelines , including a negative list to regulate market access , relaxation of border control policies , support the state-owned enterprises ( SOE ) , to borrow private capital , and overhaul the single-person reporting system .


  2973. REF: according to the statement , a negative list , identifying sectors and businesses that are off-limits for investment , will be drawn up .

    HYP: according to the statement , a negative list is created that identifies sectors and companies that are not eligible for investment .


  2974. REF: the system will be gradually tested and improved through trial programs .

    HYP: the system is gradually tested and improved by test programs .


  2975. REF: the move is significant as it will give the market a bigger role in allocating resources , ensuring a law-based business environment and making the market more open , the statement said .

    HYP: the initiative is significant because it gives the market a greater role in allocating resources , ensuring a legal business environment and making the market more open , the statement said .


  2976. REF: the government will also loosen controls on the powers it delegates to companies , making sure that companies decide how to run their businesses .

    HYP: the government will also loosen controls over the powers conferred on the companies and ensure that companies decide how to conduct their business .


  2977. REF: the statement also said China will allow border areas to explore new models of cross-border economic cooperation and new mechanisms for promoting regional growth .

    HYP: the statement also said China will allow border areas to explore new models of cross-border economic cooperation and new mechanisms to promote regional growth .


  2978. REF: in a bid to open up state-controlled sectors , more areas will be open to private investment .

    HYP: as part of a bid to open state-controlled sectors , further areas for private investment will be opened .


  2979. REF: `` The government will not change its policy toward foreign investment , and will protect the lawful interests of foreign-funded companies and provide better services for them , '' said the statement .

    HYP: `` The government will not change its policy toward foreign investment and will protect the legitimate interests of leveraged companies and provide better services for them , '' the statement said .


  2980. REF: in addition , it will be made easier for foreigners to apply for permanent residence permits , or `` green card , '' by optimizing requirements and streamlining the application process .

    HYP: in addition , it is made easier for foreigners to apply for a permanent residence permit or the `` Green Card '' by optimising the requirements and making the application process easier .


  2981. REF: guaranteeing lawyers ' right to practice and nurturing professional judges and prosecutors were also discussed at a meeting .

    HYP: guaranteeing the right of lawyers to exercise their activities , and to employ professional judges and prosecutors , was also discussed at a meeting .


  2982. REF: the meeting was also attended by Premier Li Keqiang , and senior leaders Liu Yunshan and Zhang Gaoli , according to a statement released after the meeting .

    HYP: the meeting also included Premier Li Keqiang and key leaders such as Liu Yunshan and Zhang Gaoli , as reported in a statement issued after the meeting .


  2983. REF: EU wants to double the mercury limit in predatory fish

    HYP: EU seeks to double mercury limit in predator fish


  2984. REF: the EU commission wants to double the limits for mercury in large predatory fish and consumers therefore can expect a significantly higher dose of this neurotoxin .

    HYP: the European Commission wants to double the limit values for mercury in large predators and give consumers a much higher dose of nerve .


  2985. REF: the consumer organisation Foodwatch , to which an EU working paper on the subject was made available , is heavily critical of the plans . `` Risks and side effects of inappropriate industry and environmental politics will be passed on with full force to pregnant women and small children , '' declared Matthias Wolfschmidt of Foodwatch .

    HYP: the consumer organisation Foodwatch , which has a corresponding working paper from the EU , strongly criticised the plans : `` Risks and side effects of failed industrial and environmental policies are passed with full force to pregnant women and infants , '' explained Matthias Wolfschmidt of Foodwatch .


  2986. REF: according to Wolfschmidt , the limits for the neurotoxin for large fish at the end of the food chain such as for example shark or swordfish are going to be raised from 1 to 2 mg of mercury per kilogram of fish for `` economic reasons '' .

    HYP: according to Wolfschmidt , the limits of the nerve agent for large fish are to be raised at the end of the food chain such as shark or swordfish for `` economic reasons '' from one to two milligrams of mercury per kilogram of fish .


  2987. REF: large predatory fish however are today so heavily contaminated with mercury that based on the still current limits some 50 percent of catches may not be sold .

    HYP: however , major predators are already so heavily burdened with mercury that about 50 per cent of catches can not be sold on the basis of the existing limit values .


  2988. REF: once the limit has been doubled , however , only 14.5 percent would be unsaleable .

    HYP: after doubling the limit values , then only 14.5 per cent would be unsettled .


  2989. REF: in return for this relaxation the EU , according to Foodwatch , wants to tighten the limits for other fish from the current 0.5 mg to 0.1 mg of mercury per kilogram .

    HYP: in exchange for this easing , according to Foodwatch , the EU wants to tighten the limits on other fish from currently 0.5 milligrams to 0.1 milligrams of mercury per kilogram .


  2990. REF: but Foodwatch describes this as a `` trick '' , because smaller prey fish , such as for example carp , generally have so little contamination that these planned maximum levels are already complied with today .

    HYP: Foodwatch , however , called this `` trick '' because smaller gravefish , such as carp are mostly so low , that they are already meeting the planned highs today .


  2991. REF: the reduction for small fish therefore is `` a perfidious diversionary tactic which helps only the economy , '' declares Wolfschmidt .

    HYP: the reduction in small numbers is therefore `` a perfidious distraction that helps the economy alone , '' Wolfschmidt explained .


  2992. REF: Mercury is for human beings a highly toxic heavy metal which accumulates largely in the food chain , above all in predatory fish .

    HYP: Mercury is a heavy metal that is highly toxic to humans , which spreads heavily over the food chain , especially in predators .


  2993. REF: for this reason the German government has issued a warning that `` even low levels , particularly in unborn children , can lead to damage to the nervous system '' .

    HYP: the federal government therefore warns that `` already small quantities can be particularly caused by unborn skulls of the nervous system . ''


  2994. REF: the German Environment Minister , however , declared on his home page with regard to the current maximum levels that a `` health risk to the general population '' is not anticipated .

    HYP: the Federal Ministry of the Environment , on its website with regard to current levels , says that a `` health hazard to the general population '' is not to be expected .


  2995. REF: Mercury is released into the environment primarily through the burning of coal .

    HYP: Mercury is mainly due to coal burning into the environment .


  2996. REF: German coal plants , according to written information from the German Ministry of the Environment to Green Bundestag member Annalena Baerbock , discharge more than six tonnes of mercury per year , two thirds of the total amount emitted in Germany .

    HYP: according to a written information from the Federal Ministry of the Environment , the German coal-fired power plants have more than six tonnes of mercury in the year , two-thirds of the total amount emitted in Germany , according to a written information from the Federal Environment Ministry .


  2997. REF: the concentration of mercury in fish , for example in the Elbe , Rhine and Danube , is `` extensively exceeded on a long-term basis , '' the `` Spiegel '' newspaper quoted from the paper in March .

    HYP: the concentration of mercury in fish , for example , in the Elbe , the Rhine and the Danube , was `` permanently and comprehensively crossed , '' the `` Mirror '' was quoted from the paper in March .


  2998. REF: in the past year , Europe-wide alerts on mercury in fish rated among the most frequently reported health risks in the EU warning system RASFF .

    HYP: last year , Europe-wide warnings against mercury in fish were already among the most commonly reported health risks in the EU warning system RASFF .


  2999. REF: Foodwatch is calling for consumers to protest against the EU plans under : www.quecksilber-aktion.foodwatch.de

    HYP: Foodwatch calls on consumers to protest against the EU 's plans at : Www.qumercury stock.foodwatch.co.uk
